TimePicker.name: now
TimePicker.description: Fires whenever the "NOW" button is clicked when enabled.

TimePicker.name: value
TimePicker.description: Sets the selected timestamp ISO 8601 / RFC 3339.

TimePicker.name: disabled
TimePicker.description: Disables any component of time from being selected.

TimePicker.name: readonly
TimePicker.description: Disables any component of time from being selected without visual changes.

TimePicker.name: now
TimePicker.description: Enables displaying of the "NOW" button, allowing users to set the Widget to current clock time.

TimePicker.name: scroll
TimePicker.description: Enables auto scrolling to current time on mounting.

TimePicker.name: highlight
TimePicker.description: Sets the ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 timestamp of the current time to be highlighted as outlines.

TimePicker.name: max
TimePicker.description: Sets the maximum timestamp ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 in the future that can be selected.

TimePicker.name: min
TimePicker.description: Sets the minimum timestamp ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 in the past that can be selected.

TimePicker.name: sizing
TimePicker.description: Sets the size of children / spacing relative to the font size of the TimePicker.

TimePicker.name: calendar
TimePicker.description: Alters the calendar used for calculations / formatting via Temporal Calendar Codes.

TimePicker.name: locale
TimePicker.description: Alters the locale used for displaying internationalized text via RFC 5646 / BCP 47 language tags.

TimePicker.name: hour
TimePicker.description: Alters how a displayed hour is formatted.

TimePicker.name: minute
TimePicker.description: Alters how a displayed minute is formatted.

TimePicker.name: second
TimePicker.description: Alters how a displayed second is formatted.

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {value} now />
snippets.title: TimePicker Now

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {value} scroll />
snippets.title: TimePicker Now

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {value} hour_12 />
snippets.title: TimePicker 12 Hour

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {value} disabled />
snippets.title: TimePicker Disabled

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";

    const highlight = "15:00:00";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {highlight} {value} />
snippets.title: TimePicker Highlight

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";

    const max = "15:45:30";
    const min = "11:15:00";
</script>

<TimePicker palette="accent" {max} {min} {value} />
snippets.title: TimePicker Maximum + Minimum

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const value = "13:30:15";
</script>

<TimePicker
    palette="accent"
    hour="2-digit"
    minute="2-digit"
    second="2-digit"
    {value}
    hour_12
/>
snippets.title: TimePicker Custom Format

DEFAULT
TINY

snippets.title: TimePicker Sizing

data.render:
TimePicker

TimePicker is a Widget that displays a set of hour, minute, second clock scrollable areas that a user can select from.

Imports

<script>
    import {TimePicker} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Now

You can enable the displaying of a "NOW" button to allow the user to set the picker to the current time, via the now property.

Auto Scroll

WARNING: This property will cause layout reflowing. And can result poor performance when mounted during points of high activity. e.g. when your web page first loads

You can enable auto scrolling to the currently set value when TimePicker is mounted, via the scroll property.

12 Hour

You can have the hours render as 12-hour time (1...12 AM/PM) instead of 24-hour time (0...23) via the hour_12 property.

Disabled

You can disable all interactivity via the disabled property.

Highlight

NOTE: By default, the current time is used.

You can select a specific timestamp to be highlighted as outlines via the highlight property.

Maximum + Minimum

You can set maximum and minimum range of selectable times via the maximum / minimum properties.

Custom Format

You can customize how the hour, minute, second components of the available timestamps is displayed via the hour, minute, and second properties respectively.

Sizing

You can alter the overall spacing / sizing look and feel via the sizing property.
